SENT.plain: 134 cases of paediatric tumours of the jaws in Nigerian children are reviewed
Non-odontogenic tumours and tumours of mesenchymal origin were the commonest
Among malignant disease cases, Burkitt's lymphoma predominated
Late presentation for treatment and gross disfigurement were typical clinical findings
Most of the non-Burkitt malignant lesions had grown to inoperable proportions and the few that were amenable to aggressive surgery responded poorly to treatment
